title: Leave (M?-Rated, One-Shot, DabixGenderNeutral!Reader)
body:
A one-shot request from a discord I frequent.

“Dabi x abused reader. Due to personal reasons. I just.. Really want reader to be saved“

Possibly triggering things under the cut. Open at your own risk.

Tucking the bag tighter under your arm, you took a sharp left into the alleyway nearby. Halfway down it was a fire escape that you could climb up that would take you to your third-floor apartment. If you were lucky, your absence hadn’t been noticed, yet.

Before you could contemplate jumping up to reach the hanging ladder, a voice called from above, “There you are.”

Your blood froze in your veins. So, you’d been found out. Your head tilted up slowly to take in their figure, leaning against the railing with a cigarette in their fingers that they idly flicked to ash it. They fell down onto you as you made no move to dodge them. That would only make it worse.

“And where have you been?” He was eerily calm as he spoke. From this distance, you could barely make out his jaw muscles working, and you knew that under the surface he was raging. You weren’t allowed to go out alone, if at all. That much had been made clear to you through fists to your stomach and yanking of hair.

When you didn’t answer, he started to descend slowly, the cigarette tucked between his lips snugly when he dropped from the hanging metal ladder, “Oh, are you scared?”

Your voice wouldn’t work, despite you trying to answer him. Inside you were screaming, knowing that your silence was egging him on further. If you just gave him a response, gave him what he wanted from this exchange, it wouldn’t be so bad. Maybe you could scrape by with some bruises or a sore scalp—

When he crossed the distance and grabbed your arm, your thoughts were interrupted by his cigarette being put out with the delicate flesh on the inside of your wrist. Suddenly, your voice returned with a screech as you tried to yank your arm away. His previously impassive face turned into a pleased grin as he reached into his pocket and pulled out the lighter he favored.

He hadn’t allowed you to pull away despite your protests, and the flame of the lighter started to grow closer and closer to your arm—

Until a hand dropped onto his shoulder. In your terror, you hadn’t noticed another figure approaching. He turned slowly, the lighter flickering out but a different sort of flames erupting to illuminate the area. The figure’s shoulders flickered with a strange blue flame, and slowly those flames moved down the arm linked with your partner.

“Wha—”

“Shh,” The new man interrupted, and his fingers visibly tightened as he spoke next, “I think you should leave.”

Contradicting your partner was a huge taboo, and the fear in your heart started up again as his face twisted in anger, “Excuse me—”

Before his next words could get out, those blue flames shot out with a vengeance and curled around your partner’s shoulder. It took a split-second for the pain to register, but when it did his screams echoed off the walls as he stumbled away and frantically tried to smother them out. Before you could see if he was successful, the new man curled that same hand around your elbow and started to tug you away.

“W-Wait, please, I can’t!”

“You can, and you will. Just shut up and let’s go,” The man’s voice was angry for some reason, and you immediately clammed up and let him drag you further down the alleyway and around the corner. There was a steel door inlaid in the wall, and he pushed it open without a sound and dragged you inside.

It took you a moment to adjust to the low light, and you realized it was simply an entryway to a stairwell that went up. At the top of the stairs was another door, but the man only turned to you in the small space, “Your arm. Let me see.”

“I-It’s not—”

He let out an irritated sigh and snatched your wrist from where it dangled at your side. With a smooth movement, he lifted and turned it to see the circular burn that had been left there, “Fucker. C’mon.”

Once more, he pulled you up the stairs by the wrist, and you off-handedly noted that his fingers were carefully arranged so he didn’t brush against your new injury. At the top, he opened the door to reveal what looked to be some sort of hideout, with ramshackle shelving and a cot in the corner. There was a table that he pulled you over to, and without a word of warning his grabbed you under both armpits and deposited you on that table with your legs over the side.

You were terrified, that much was for sure. This was a strange man, and in the light,  you could see that he was covered in a patchwork of scars held to his contrasting smooth skin with what looked like staples or piercings. Shrugging out of the coat his wore, he turned to the shelf next to the desk you were on and grabbed a tube of something, “This’ll help.”

He smoothed it onto your burn without you asking for help, and he capped the tube and tossed it haphazardly on the desk next to you. With a slam, his arms caged you in on the desk and he leaned forward into your space. His eyes were analyzing as he looked over your features, and he scoffed, “He’s really got you fucked up, doesn’t he?”

You said nothing, only nervously looking between his blue eyes and the opposite wall behind him. He took note of this and stood straight again to allow you breathing room once more, “You’d be stupid to go back to him.”

“Maybe I’m stupid…”

“Doubt it, but you know yourself better than I do. Either way, this is your chance to get out. If I were you, I wouldn’t screw around and go back to that,” With a vague gesture to your wrist, he turned a half-step away, “It’s hard to leave, trust me I get it, but it’s gonna get you killed if you don’t ditch him.”

You nodded your assent and looked to the floor, and he let out a long sigh and reached for your chin to pull your gaze back up, “Work on looking people in the eye. Don’t let people walk over you, that’s how you got into that mess in the first place.”

His fingers were smooth as he slipped his hand from your chin and gestured to the door, “You can leave if you want, or stay here to calm down, I don’t care. But I’ve got shit to do, so I’m heading out. Take care of yourself.”

After a long look that said something you weren’t capable of deciphering at the moment, he shrugged his jacket back on and the door slammed behind him with a resolute thud.
body_abstract:
A one-shot request from a discord I frequent.

“Dabi x abused reader. Due to personal reasons. I just.. Really want reader to be saved“

Possibly triggering things under the cut. Open at your own risk.

Tucking the bag tighter under your arm, you took a sharp left into the alleyway nearby. Halfway down it was a fire escape that you could climb up that would take you to your third-floor apartment. If you were lucky, your absence hadn’t been noticed, yet.

Before you could contemplate jumping up to reach the hanging ladder, a voice called from above, “There you are.”

Your blood froze in your veins. So, you’d been found out. Your head tilted up slowly to take in their figure, leaning against the railing with a cigarette in their fingers that they idly flicked to ash it. They fell down onto you as you made no move to dodge them. That would only make it worse.

“And where have you been?” He was eerily calm as he spoke. From this distance, you could barely make out his jaw muscles working, and you knew that under the surface he was raging. You weren’t allowed to go out alone, if at all. That much had been made clear to you through fists to your stomach and yanking of hair.

When you didn’t answer, he started to descend slowly, the cigarette tucked between his lips snugly when he dropped from the hanging metal ladder, “Oh, are you scared?”

Your voice wouldn’t work, despite you trying to answer him. Inside you were screaming, knowing that your silence was egging him on further. If you just gave him a response, gave him what he wanted from this exchange, it wouldn’t be so bad. Maybe you could scrape by with some bruises or a sore scalp—

When he crossed the distance and grabbed your arm, your thoughts were interrupted by his cigarette being put out with the delicate flesh on the inside of your wrist. Suddenly, your voice returned with a screech as you tried to yank your arm away. His previously impassive face turned into a pleased grin as he reached into his pocket and pulled out the lighter he favored.

He hadn’t allowed you to pull away despite your protests, and the flame of the lighter started to grow closer and closer to your arm—

Until a hand dropped onto his shoulder. In your terror, you hadn’t noticed another figure approaching. He turned slowly, the lighter flickering out but a different sort of flames erupting to illuminate the area. The figure’s shoulders flickered with a strange blue flame, and slowly those flames moved down the arm linked with your partner.

“Wha—”

“Shh,” The new man interrupted, and his fingers visibly tightened as he spoke next, “I think you should leave.”

Contradicting your partner was a huge taboo, and the fear in your heart started up again as his face twisted in anger, “Excuse me—”

Before his next words could get out, those blue flames shot out with a vengeance and curled around your partner’s shoulder. It took a split-second for the pain to register, but when it did his screams echoed off the walls as he stumbled away and frantically tried to smother them out. Before you could see if he was successful, the new man curled that same hand around your elbow and started to tug you away.

“W-Wait, please, I can’t!”

“You can, and you will. Just shut up and let’s go,” The man’s voice was angry for some reason, and you immediately clammed up and let him drag you further down the alleyway and around the corner. There was a steel door inlaid in the wall, and he pushed it open without a sound and dragged you inside.

It took you a moment to adjust to the low light, and you realized it was simply an entryway to a stairwell that went up. At the top of the stairs was another door, but the man only turned to you in the small space, “Your arm. Let me see.”

“I-It’s not—”

He let out an irritated sigh and snatched your wrist from where it dangled at your side. With a smooth movement, he lifted and turned it to see the circular burn that had been left there, “Fucker. C’mon.”

Once more, he pulled you up the stairs by the wrist, and you off-handedly noted that his fingers were carefully arranged so he didn’t brush against your new injury. At the top, he opened the door to reveal what looked to be some sort of hideout, with ramshackle shelving and a cot in the corner. There was a table that he pulled you over to, and without a word of warning his grabbed you under both armpits and deposited you on that table with your legs over the side.

You were terrified, that much was for sure. This was a strange man, and in the light,  you could see that he was covered in a patchwork of scars held to his contrasting smooth skin with what looked like staples or piercings. Shrugging out of the coat his wore, he turned to the shelf next to the desk you were on and grabbed a tube of something, “This’ll help.”

He smoothed it onto your burn without you asking for help, and he capped the tube and tossed it haphazardly on the desk next to you. With a slam, his arms caged you in on the desk and he leaned forward into your space. His eyes were analyzing as he looked over your features, and he scoffed, “He’s really got you fucked up, doesn’t he?”

You said nothing, only nervously looking between his blue eyes and the opposite wall behind him. He took note of this and stood straight again to allow you breathing room once more, “You’d be stupid to go back to him.”

“Maybe I’m stupid…”

“Doubt it, but you know yourself better than I do. Either way, this is your chance to get out. If I were you, I wouldn’t screw around and go back to that,” With a vague gesture to your wrist, he turned a half-step away, “It’s hard to leave, trust me I get it, but it’s gonna get you killed if you don’t ditch him.”

You nodded your assent and looked to the floor, and he let out a long sigh and reached for your chin to pull your gaze back up, “Work on looking people in the eye. Don’t let people walk over you, that’s how you got into that mess in the first place.”

His fingers were smooth as he slipped his hand from your chin and gestured to the door, “You can leave if you want, or stay here to calm down, I don’t care. But I’ve got shit to do, so I’m heading out. Take care of yourself.”

After a long look that said something you weren’t capable of deciphering at the moment, he shrugged his jacket back on and the door slammed behind him with a resolute thud.

“And where have you been?” He was eerily calm as he spoke. From this distance, you could barely make out his jaw muscles working, and you knew that under the surface he was raging. You weren’t allowed to go out alone, if at all. That much had been made clear to you through fists to your stomach and yanking of hair.

When you didn’t answer, he started to descend slowly, the cigarette tucked between his lips snugly when he dropped from the hanging metal ladder, “Oh, are you scared?”

Your voice wouldn’t work, despite you trying to answer him. Inside you were screaming, knowing that your silence was egging him on further. If you just gave him a response, gave him what he wanted from this exchange, it wouldn’t be so bad. Maybe you could scrape by with some bruises or a sore scalp—

When he crossed the distance and grabbed your arm, your thoughts were interrupted by his cigarette being put out with the delicate flesh on the inside of your wrist. Suddenly, your voice returned with a screech as you tried to yank your arm away. His previously impassive face turned into a pleased grin as he reached into his pocket and pulled out the lighter he favored.

He hadn’t allowed you to pull away despite your protests, and the flame of the lighter started to grow closer and closer to your arm—

Until a hand dropped onto his shoulder. In your terror, you hadn’t noticed another figure approaching. He turned slowly, the lighter flickering out but a different sort of flames erupting to illuminate the area. The figure’s shoulders flickered with a strange blue flame, and slowly those flames moved down the arm linked with your partner.

“Wha—”

“Shh,” The new man interrupted, and his fingers visibly tightened as he spoke next, “I think you should leave.”

Contradicting your partner was a huge taboo, and the fear in your heart started up again as his face twisted in anger, “Excuse me—”

Before his next words could get out, those blue flames shot out with a vengeance and curled around your partner’s shoulder. It took a split-second for the pain to register, but when it did his screams echoed off the walls as he stumbled away and frantically tried to smother them out. Before you could see if he was successful, the new man curled that same hand around your elbow and started to tug you away.

“W-Wait, please, I can’t!”

“You can, and you will. Just shut up and let’s go,” The man’s voice was angry for some reason, and you immediately clammed up and let him drag you further down the alleyway and around the corner. There was a steel door inlaid in the wall, and he pushed it open without a sound and dragged you inside.

It took you a moment to adjust to the low light, and you realized it was simply an entryway to a stairwell that went up. At the top of the stairs was another door, but the man only turned to you in the small space, “Your arm. Let me see.”

“I-It’s not—”

He let out an irritated sigh and snatched your wrist from where it dangled at your side. With a smooth movement, he lifted and turned it to see the circular burn that had been left there, “Fucker. C’mon.”

Once more, he pulled you up the stairs by the wrist, and you off-handedly noted that his fingers were carefully arranged so he didn’t brush against your new injury. At the top, he opened the door to reveal what looked to be some sort of hideout, with ramshackle shelving and a cot in the corner. There was a table that he pulled you over to, and without a word of warning his grabbed you under both armpits and deposited you on that table with your legs over the side.

You were terrified, that much was for sure. This was a strange man, and in the light,  you could see that he was covered in a patchwork of scars held to his contrasting smooth skin with what looked like staples or piercings. Shrugging out of the coat his wore, he turned to the shelf next to the desk you were on and grabbed a tube of something, “This’ll help.”

He smoothed it onto your burn without you asking for help, and he capped the tube and tossed it haphazardly on the desk next to you. With a slam, his arms caged you in on the desk and he leaned forward into your space. His eyes were analyzing as he looked over your features, and he scoffed, “He’s really got you fucked up, doesn’t he?”

You said nothing, only nervously looking between his blue eyes and the opposite wall behind him. He took note of this and stood straight again to allow you breathing room once more, “You’d be stupid to go back to him.”

“Maybe I’m stupid…”

“Doubt it, but you know yourself better than I do. Either way, this is your chance to get out. If I were you, I wouldn’t screw around and go back to that,” With a vague gesture to your wrist, he turned a half-step away, “It’s hard to leave, trust me I get it, but it’s gonna get you killed if you don’t ditch him.”

You nodded your assent and looked to the floor, and he let out a long sigh and reached for your chin to pull your gaze back up, “Work on looking people in the eye. Don’t let people walk over you, that’s how you got into that mess in the first place.”

His fingers were smooth as he slipped his hand from your chin and gestured to the door, “You can leave if you want, or stay here to calm down, I don’t care. But I’ve got shit to do, so I’m heading out. Take care of yourself.”

After a long look that said something you weren’t capable of deciphering at the moment, he shrugged his jacket back on and the door slammed behind him with a resolute thud.

Do you think the other students forget that Kiri has pointy teeth sometimes because he’s a sweet boy and then he laughs or yawns and people are,,, SHOOK

Bonus pointy teeth boi

blog.name: ao3feed-bakudeku
blog.title: ao3feed-BakuDeku
blog.description:
Katsuki Bakugou / Izuku Midoriya fanfics on Ao3
Blog created April 2, 2019. No fics before this date will be archived.
This page is still under construction

title: The Greatest Good
description:
by The_Crafty_Cracker

“Oh, fucking hell no, don’t you dare think about running off and doing hero work! Shitty Deku! We’ve been planning this dinner for two months!”

“The public is in danger!”

“My evening is in danger!”

“Tell me where my gear is, Kacchan!” Izuku insisted, waving his hands around in emphasis, “We are talking about the greater good!”

“Greater good?” Katsuki growled, jabbing a finger at Izuku’s chest, “I am your husband! I’m the greatest fucking good
you are ever gonna get!”

Words: 1600, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Midoriya Izuku, Bakugou Katsuki

blog.name: blueetaurus
blog.title: How to Be a Human Being

body:
Pride month-day 4

Pride Ship #4 ~ Kiribaku

“If you refuse to go down, it means you’re stupidly strong.”

Bonus:

“When I heard that they were after my [friend]…I couldn’t do anything!! I didn’t do anything!! If I don’t act now…forget being a hero, I’m not even a man!”

In summary: soft(hard) boy + angery fire boy = hella gay

blog.name: 3heroes1mom-bnha
blog.title: The strangest ot4 youll ever see
blog.description: This is a shitpost ship rp/askblog, and we love it very much. You will be able to send asks to, Inko, Endeavor, Hawks, and Aizawa. We're semi serious, so we can take serious asks. M!A's are allowed!

summary: Don't any of you get scared of endeavor and his temper?
question: Don't any of you get scared of endeavor and his temper?
answer:
Never. We KNOW what he’s done, he’s a changed man. He would never hurt any of us on purpose. I can personally assure you he’s actually a real sweetheart around is. 

-modzawa

(holy fuck hi i wanted to revive this on my own but uhm inko and mic i dont think are with us anymore :(( )
